rev.comment: /* Corporatism */ I hope that this rewording, as much style as substance, satisfies editors who have recently come into conflict over the wording of this section
reverting the anti-consensus removal of information
The National Recovery Administration is a corporate cartel, price-fixing and production control was rampant. What part of New Deal fascism do you not understand?
New Deal is corporatist follows directed from the definition of [[corporatism]].
/* Corporatism */ The New Deal is not by any means clearly corporatist. If you claim it is, give a citation.
/* Definition */ recognizing economic aspects of fascism
Those accused of [[usury]], [[war profiteering]], or other capitalist excesses are viciously persecuted.
Capitalism is diminshed, but not eliminated. [[Usury]] and [[war profiteering]] are viciously persecuted.
Nazism certainly merits a mention in the lead section
replaced redundent totalitarian quote with a quote re: the economics of fascism

Reword to clarify that these economic policies, while typical in fascist states, are not necessarily specifially fascist. An economic system alone is not enough to constitute fascism.
/* The origin and ideology of Fascism */
/* Italian Fascism */ Mussolini states that fascism negates the doctrine of Marxist socialism and it's doctrine of [[historical materialism]].
